009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D50;
013import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D65;
014
015import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
016
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019
020/**
021 * Defines a linear RGB space with the same white point and primaries as
022 * sRGB. Everything is D65, components of all {@code float[]} colors are
023 * supposed to be in [0,1]. This is a singleton class with no public
024 * constructors, use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 * @version 2022/11/14
028 * @see sRgbColorSpace
029 */
030@SuppressWarnings("serial")
031public class LinearRgb65ColorSpace extends ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion, RgbPrimaries {
032        
033        // we use the same RGB-XYZ matrices as sRGB
034        /** Matrix for conversion from XYZ to linear RGB. Its column vectors are the 
035         * XYZ coordinates of the RGB primaries. */
036        private static final double[][] Mrgbi = 
037                {{0.412453, 0.357580, 0.180423},
038                 {0.212671, 0.715160, 0.072169},
039                 {0.019334, 0.119193, 0.950227}};
040        
041        private static final float[][] MrgbiF = Matrix.toFloat(Mrgbi);
042        
043        /** Matrix for conversion from linear RGB to XYZ (inverse of {@link #Mrgbi}). */
044        private static final double[][] Mrgb = Matrix.inverse(Mrgbi);
045        private static final float[][] MrgbF = Matrix.toFloat(Mrgb);
046        
047        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D65, D50);
048        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50, D65);
049        private static final GammaMappingFunction GammaMap = GammaMappingFunction.sRGB;
050        
051        private static final LinearRgb65ColorSpace instance = new LinearRgb65ColorSpace();
052        
053        public static LinearRgb65ColorSpace getInstance() {
054                return instance;
055        }
056        
057        /** Constructor, non-public */
058        private LinearRgb65ColorSpace() {
059                super(ColorSpace.TYPE_RGB, 3);
060        }
061        
062        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
063
064        @Override
065        public float[] getWhitePoint() {
066                return Matrix.toFloat(D65.getXYZ());
067        }
068        
069        @Override
070        public float[] getPrimary(int idx) {
071                return Matrix.toFloat(Matrix.getColumn(Mrgbi, idx));
072        }
073        
074        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
075
076        @Override       // directly convert non-linear sRGB to linear rgb (D65-based)
077        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
078//              final float[] rgb = new float[3];
079//              for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
080//                      rgb[k] = GammaMap.applyInv(srgb[k]);
081//              }
082                float[] rgb = GammaMap.applyInv(srgb);
083                return rgb;
084        }
085
086        @Override       // directly convert linear rgb (D65-based) to non-linear sRGB
087        public float[] toRGB(float[] rgb) {
088//              final float[] srgb = new float[3];
089//              for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
090//                      srgb[k] = GammaMap.applyFwd(rgb[k]);
091//              }
092                float[] srgb = GammaMap.applyFwd(rgb);
093                return srgb;
094        }
095        
096        @Override       // return D50-based PCS xyz
097        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] rgb) {
098                float[] xyz65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(rgb);
099                float[] xyz50 = catD65toD50.applyTo(xyz65);
100                return xyz50;
101        }
102        
103        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
104
105        @Override
106        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] xyz50) {
107                float[] xyz65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(xyz50);
108                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(xyz65);
109        }
110        
111        @Override
112        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] rgb) {
113                float[] xyz65 = Matrix.multiply(MrgbiF, rgb);
114                return xyz65;
115        }
116        
117        @Override
118        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] xyz65) {
119                float[] rgb = Matrix.multiply(MrgbF, xyz65);
120                return rgb;
121        }
122        
123        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
124        
125        private static final String[] ComponentNames = {"R", "G", "B"};
126        
127        @Override
128        public String getName (int idx) {
129                return ComponentNames[idx];
130        }
131        
132}
